title: Understanding $$f(x-h)$$
text: For some value $$h$$, $$f(x-h)$$ means that f(x) is translated to the right by $$h$$ units. Similarly, $$f{\left(x+h\right)}$$ means that f(x) is translated to the left by $$h$$ units.
speech: For some value  h , , f of, parentheses x minus h,   means that f(x) is translated to the right by  h  units. Similarly, , f of, parentheses x plus h,   means that f(x) is translated to the left by  h  units.

title: Understanding $$f(x-h)$$
text: Since $$h$$ is $$4$$, $$f(x-4)$$ means that the graph is translated right by $$4$$.
speech: Since  h  is  4 , , f of, parentheses x minus 4,   means that the graph is translated right by  4 .
pacedSpeech: means that the graph is translated right by   4

title: Understanding $$f{\left(\frac{x}{h}\right)}$$
text: For some value $$h$$ not equal to $$0$$, $$f{\left(\frac{x}{h}\right)}$$ means that f(x) is stretched horizontally by $$h$$. Similarly, $$f{\left(h x\right)}$$ means that f(x) is compressed horizontally by $$h$$.
speech: For some value  h  not equal to  0 , , f of, parentheses x over h,   means that f(x) is stretched horizontally by  h . Similarly,  f of h x,  means that f(x) is compressed horizontally by  h .
pacedSpeech: means that f(x) is stretched horizontally by   h
means that f(x) is compressed horizontally by   h

title: Understanding $$f{\left(\frac{x}{h}\right)}$$
text: Since $$h$$ is $$\frac{1}{2}$$, $$f{\left(\frac{x}{2}-4\right)}$$ means that the graph is stretched horizontally by $$2$$.
speech: Since  h  is  1 half ,  f of, parentheses, x over 2, minus 4,   means that the graph is stretched horizontally by  2 .
pacedSpeech: means that the graph is stretched horizontally by   2

title: Does Order Matter?
text: The order of transformation does not matter if each transformation is performed independently on the input (within the paranethesis of the function) and output (outside the paranethesis of the function).
speech: The order of transformation does not matter if each transformation is performed independently on the input (within the paranethesis of the function) and output (outside the paranethesis of the function).
pacedSpeech: The order of transformation does not matter if each transformation is performed independently on the input (within the paranethesis of the function) and output (outside the paranethesis of the function).

title: Does Order Matter?
text: Is the translation right performed on the input or output of the function?
speech: Is the translation right performed on the input or output of the function?
pacedSpeech: Is the translation right performed on the input or output of the function?

title: Does Order Matter?
text: Is the stretch horizontally performed on the input or output of the function?
speech: Is the stretch horizontally performed on the input or output of the function?

title: Does Order Matter?
text: Since the transformations were both performed on the input, the order does matter.
speech: Since the transformations were both performed on the input, the order does matter.
